description.narrative:
Goal: Improve food security for rural farm families through diversified economic opportunities, food production and gender empowerment.
Objective 1: Increase food security for 150 families, a total of 900 persons, through improved agricultural practices and market-driven economic opportunities in rural coffee communities.
Objective 2: Contribute to local governance on food security issues by forming alliances between public, private and community entities that involve coffee producing families.

The three-year Empowering Food Secure Communities Program seeks to transition coffee farming families from being victims of food insecurity to having the capacity and resources to feed their families. The program will do this through the creation of income-generating home gardens using appropriate technologies and promoting other economic alternatives while also creating systemic change through civic participation with local and national government institutions. Central to our success will be empowering women as change-makers by developing their business and leadership skills through a variety of methods, from climate-smart agriculture training to business incubator groups. Our strategy for sustainability is to invest in 150 families (approximately 900 people) who will serve as ‘multipliers,’ spreading their successful agriculture, nutrition and business practices throughout local community and business organizations as well as advancing change in government entities responsible for nutritional and food security.
